Israel says it has received remains of four more Gaza hostages
subhead: This latest transfer comes a day after Israel received the bodies of four other dead hostages, who were later identified on Tuesday. There have been concerns that the militant group is handing over remains more slowly than agreed, but Hamas and the Red Cross have said that the process is a challenge because of Gaza's destruction
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Trump posthumously honors 'martyr' Charlie Kirk with the Presidential Medal of Freedom
subhead: Tuesday's ceremony coincided with what would have been Kirk’s 32nd birthday, just over a month after the right-wing activist was fatally shot while speaking to a crowd at Utah Valley University. Meanwhile, the US State Department said it had revoked visas of at least six foreign nationals who had 'celebrated the heinous assassination.'

title: California plans on protecting minors and preventing self-destructive content by regulating AI
subhead: The legislation, signed on Monday by Democratic Governor Gavin Newsom, requires platforms to remind users that they are interacting with a chatbot − not a human − and to direct users to emergency services if they express suicidal thoughts.

First Wap, a discreet cyber-surveillance firm tracking journalists, public figures and corporate executives
subhead: Little known to the public, this long-standing player in the surveillance industry has been selling phone-tracking technology for more than 20 years, including to authoritarian regimes. Among its targets: a journalist investigating the Vatican, an Airbus employee, and Hollywood actor Jared Leto.
